title: Hundreds of students displaced after burst pipe closes UMass Boston dorm
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A burst sprinkler pipe at UMass Boston displaced hundreds of students, closing the East Residence Hall since Monday.
About 50 rooms in the residence hall suffered water damage; students face a lack of communication and housing uncertainty.
A temporary dining hall reopening and housing arrangements at UMass Amherst are provided; shuttles operate between campuses.

title: Seattle Public Library schools the Boston Public Library with book recommendations for Patriots fans
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Seattle Public Library suggested 35 Seattle-themed books to Boston Public Library after Patriots' loss to Seahawks in Super Bowl LX.
Notable titles include Michael Bennett's memoir 'Things That Make White People Uncomfortable' and 'Loser' by Clark Humphrey.
Both libraries participate in Books Unbanned, promoting the freedom for teens to read without censorship.

title: State auditor sues Beacon Hill to force compliance with audit
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: State Auditor Diana DiZoglio sues to enforce a voter-approved mandate authorizing her to audit the Massachusetts Legislature.
Attorney General Andrea Campbell refuses to support DiZoglio's lawsuit, questioning her authority to audit legislative activities.
House Speaker Ronald Mariano and Senate President Karen Spilka are named as defendants; they claim annual independent audits suffice.

title: Man arrested in Seaport, charged with human trafficking
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Schineider Dave Macean, 23, was arrested by BPD in Seaport, charged with human trafficking and prostitution-related offenses.
The arrest followed an undercover operation by the Boston Police Human Trafficking Unit and State Police.
Macean is scheduled for arraignment in South Boston District Court, according to Boston police.

title: As Boston residents report daytime coyote sightings, here’s how to stay safe
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Eastern coyotes have been frequently spotted in Boston during their mating season, particularly in areas like Jamaica Plain and the South End.
MassWildlife advises residents to keep pets indoors and practice hazing to deter coyotes, especially during winter months.
Coyote attacks on humans in Massachusetts are very rare, with fewer than 10 reported incidents statewide in 60 years.

title: Cam Newton reverses course with his comments on Drake Maye after Super Bowl loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Cam Newton praised Patriots quarterback Drake Maye after the team's Super Bowl loss despite earlier criticism during the 2025 season.
Newton acknowledged Maye's development into an MVP candidate, urging him to learn from the loss and focus on future success.
Drake Maye struggled in the playoffs, with two interceptions and a fumble in the Super Bowl, but finished as the regular season MVP runner-up.

title: James Hagens wins Beanpot MVP as Bruins prospects thrive in tournament
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: James Hagens named 2026 Beanpot MVP after leading Boston College to victory with two goals and three assists.
Hagens, a Boston Bruins prospect, showcases improved all-around game while leading BC with 31 points this season.
Fellow Bruins prospects, including 6'7" Dean Letourneau, contribute significantly in BC's 6-2 win over Boston University.

title: Patriots CB Carlton Davis shares his pitch to free agents ahead of busy offseason
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots cornerback Carlton Davis is optimistic about attracting free agents after a Super Bowl loss to the Seahawks.
The Patriots are poised to spend in the offseason, with $42.7 million in cap space and few pending free agents.
New England's recent success and team culture are becoming appealing factors for potential free agents, according to insiders.

title: Sticker shock for a dealerâ€™s quote to replace a starter
author: John Paul
bullets: A reader was quoted $1,200 for a starter replacement on a 2014 Honda Accord EX.
John Paul from AAA Northeast estimates $925 for parts and labor, suggesting higher labor costs may explain the dealer's quote.
Dealerships can charge 30-36% more than independent shops; AAA suggests using approved repair shops for cost savings.

title: Where will Kristian Campbell play in the field for the Red Sox in 2026?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox plan to play Kristian Campbell primarily in the outfield, moving away from second base role.
Campbell struggled defensively at second base with a minus-16 defensive runs saved in 2025.
Campbell could serve as a designated hitter, but Red Sox have a crowded outfield and lineup options.
